result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa L Hadley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution as read in from case 15-CF-98, joint and several with Joshua Hadley, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment as medically able and as determined by Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 years upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from Dept. of Corrections.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Subpoena and Certificate of Service - Tara Feurig

11:49 AM Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Tara Feurig present in court.  Court reviews events in file, questions how defendant is doing on probation.  Agent Feurig indicates defendant has made 2 - $100 payments since June as ordered by the Court.  Defendant indicates she is working, employers slow season is October - December then picks up again in January.  Defendant explains where she's at financially, indicates she's trying to do the best she can.  Agent Feurig is new to this case, has not seen any violations by defendant since she's been on the case.   State requests extending the deferred agreement in 15-CF-98 for another year, probation has already been extended in this case   Court makes statement, extends deferred agreement in 15-CF-98 for another year, sets another probation review hearing in this matter.  Probation review hearing scheduled for August 10, 2020 at 11:45 am.
Subpoena and Proof of Service Tara Feurig
New discharge date is 8/15/20.
from DOC Agent Tim Greil with petition to extend probation
Order Extending Probation
and stipulation to waive appearance and hearing
Subpoena and Proof of Service Tim  Greil.pdf

03:03 PM Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Tim Greil present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions Agent Greil on payments being made by defendant.  Agent Greil indicates defendant has only made one payment of $110 since being placed on probation. Agent Greil advises defendant did have a medical issue, encouraged defendant to look for work with more hours.  Defendant indicates she has work comp medical issue, job is seasonal with limited hours.  Defendant indicates restitution was ordered joint and several with ex-husband, not sure what type of payments he's been making.  Agent Greil indicates probation will be extended as defendant will not have restitution paid by discharge date. Court reviews ex-husbands case where he was Court ordered to pay $100 per month toward restitution owing.  Ms. Hadley in agreement with probation being extended, concerned regarding DJA in another case and what may be happening with that.  Further discussion. Court orders defendant to make $100 per month payments toward restitution starting on 7/01/19.  Court sets another PRH for 8/26/19 when defendant will be in court on another matter.  Probation review hearing scheduled for August 26, 2019 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Bail Jumping, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 1 and Cts. 2 & 3 as charged.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 and Cts. 2 & 3 as charges. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions status. Defense advises of discussions with State, requests recess. Parties return. Defense advises that Defendant wants trial. Discussion regarding which case should be set first. Court will set 15-CF-98 for trial first. This case will continue to track that file for now. Bond continues as is.
from Atty Reetz requesting 60 day continuance of pretrial/status.
Status conference on June 27, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz received some new information regarding  case 15-CF-98, needs some time to look into this information. Atty Reetz requests a status the week of 4/11/16 as he's not available 4/04/16. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Reetz requesting that 2/11 hearing be rescheduled
from Rose Wodack in support of Defendant
by State
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:30.

Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. State does not have Information, advises charges will be identical.

Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.
No violent contact with JH. Not to engage in self-harming behavior. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.
Door County Jail

Defendant Melissa L Hadley appeared by video conference. Attorney Brett E Reetz appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 1/11/16, 1:45.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 1/4/16. (fingerprint card destroyed 8/18/16)
